function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Spread of COVID-19 in indoor spaces with high occupancy density and inadequate ventilation.","Impact":"Increased risk of COVID-19 transmission and potential outbreaks in indoor spaces.","Mitigation":"Improving ventilation systems, reducing occupancy density, and implementing social distancing measures.","Technologies":"HVAC systems with high-efficiency particulate air (HEPA) filters, air purifiers, and CO2 sensors for monitoring air quality.","People":"People attending open-plan offices and school classrooms.","Owner":"Building managers, school administrators, and government health agencies."},{"Description":"Non-adherence to Florence Nightingale's design principles for indoor environments, such as high ceilings, natural lighting, and ventilation.","Impact":"Increased risk of viral transmission due to poor indoor environment design.","Mitigation":"Retrofitting existing indoor spaces to improve ventilation, lighting, and layout design.","Technologies":"Skylights, natural ventilation systems, and smart lighting systems.","People":"Building designers, architects, and interior planners.","Owner":"Building owners, property developers, and government regulations."},{"Description":"Lack of consideration for new and transmissible SARS-CoV-2 variants in indoor spaces.","Impact":"Increased risk of exposure to more contagious COVID-19 variants and potential rapid spread within indoor environments.","Mitigation":"Regular monitoring of COVID-19 variant data and updating ventilation and air filtration systems accordingly.","Technologies":"Genomic surveillance for variant identification, advanced air filtration systems with high capture efficiency for small particles.","People":"Health authorities, government health agencies, and building managers.","Owner":"Building managers, government health agencies, and research institutions."}]}
